description: When the user feels like there's no way out, and believes their situation or sins are beyond Allah’s mercy or help.

primary.text_en: Say, 'O My servants who have transgressed against themselves [by sinning], do not despair of the mercy of Allah. Indeed, Allah forgives all sins. Indeed, it is He who is the Forgiving, the Merciful.'
primary.text_ar: قُلْ يَا عِبَادِيَ ٱلَّذِينَ أَسْرَفُواْ عَلَىٰٓ أَنفُسِهِمْ لَا تَقْنَطُواْ مِن رَّحْمَةِ ٱللَّهِ...
primary.explanation: This ayah is one of the most powerful calls to hope for sinners. Allah *commands* you not to lose hope.

primary.text_en: Indeed, with hardship comes ease. Indeed, with hardship comes ease.
primary.text_ar: فَإِنَّ مَعَ ٱلْعُسْرِ يُسْرًا ﴿٥﴾ إِنَّ مَعَ ٱلْعُسْرِ يُسْرًۭا ﴿٦﴾
primary.explanation: Repeated twice for emphasis — ease will always follow hardship. Always.

primary.text_en: ...And whoever fears Allah—He will make a way out for them and provide for them from where they do not expect...
primary.text_ar: وَمَن يَتَّقِ ٱللَّهَ يَجْعَل لَّهُۥ مَخْرَجًۭا ﴿٢﴾ وَيَرْزُقْهُ مِنْ حَيْثُ لَا يَحْتَسِبُ...
primary.explanation: Even when things seem stuck, Allah can open unexpected doors.

primary.text_en: Do not lose hope in the mercy of Allah. Indeed, no one despairs of relief from Allah except the disbelieving people.
primary.text_ar: إِنَّهُۥ لَا يَيۡـَٔسُ مِن رَّوۡحِ ٱللَّهِ إِلَّا ٱلۡقَوۡمُ ٱلۡكَـٰفِرُونَ
primary.explanation: Losing hope is not just sad — it's spiritually dangerous. This ayah is a wake-up and comfort.

primary.text_en: Allah does not burden a soul beyond what it can bear...
primary.text_ar: لَا يُكَلِّفُ ٱللَّهُ نَفْسًا إِلَّا وُسْعَهَا...
primary.explanation: You are not weak. Allah *knows* your strength, even if you don’t.

extra.text_en: Did We not expand for you, [O Muhammad], your chest? And We removed from you your burden...
extra.explanation: A reminder that relief has come before, and it will come again.

extra.text_en: And that it is He who makes [one] laugh and weep.
extra.explanation: Allah controls your emotions — and He can turn sorrow into joy.

extra.text_en: Your Lord has not abandoned you, nor has He detested you. And surely what comes after is better for you than what has gone before.
extra.explanation: This surah was revealed when the Prophet ﷺ himself felt distant from Allah.

extra.text_en: And if We give man a taste of mercy from Us and then withdraw it from him, indeed, he is despairing and ungrateful.
extra.text_ar: وَلَئِنْ أَذَقْنَا ٱلْإِنسَٰنَ مِنَّا رَحْمَةًۭ ثُمَّ نَزَعْنَـٰهَا مِنْهُ إِنَّهُۥ لَيَـُٔوسٌۭ كَفُورٌۭ
extra.explanation: Despair is a common human weakness, but Allah teaches us to rise above it.

extra.text_en: And We will surely test you with something of fear and hunger and a loss of wealth and lives and fruits, but give good tidings to the patient...
extra.explanation: Tests come with glad tidings for those who hold on.

primary.text_en: Allah says: ‘O son of Adam, so long as you call upon Me and ask of Me, I shall forgive you, whatever your sins may be.’
primary.explanation: No sin is too great if you turn to Him sincerely.
A direct prophetic echo of the Quran. Trust the relief is coming.

primary.text_en: If you put your trust completely in Allah, He will provide for you as He provides for the birds: they go out hungry and return full.
primary.explanation: This shows how Allah sustains even when you have nothing in hand.

primary.text_en: When Allah loves a people, He tests them. Whoever accepts it gains His pleasure...
primary.explanation: Pain may be a sign of His special attention, not abandonment.

primary.text_en: Indeed, Allah stretches out His Hand at night to forgive those who sinned during the day...
primary.explanation: Allah's door is open 24/7 — don’t ever think it’s closed.

extra.text_en: The most severely tested people are the prophets, then the next best, and then the next best...
extra.explanation: Even the prophets were tested deeply. You’re not alone.

extra.text_en: None of you should wish for death due to a calamity, but if he must, then say: O Allah, keep me alive as long as life is better for me...
extra.explanation: Even in deep despair, trust Allah’s wisdom about what’s best.

extra.text_en: He who remembers his Lord and he who does not are like the living and the dead.
extra.explanation: Remembrance brings the soul back to life. Start with a single dhikr.

extra.text_en: Make things easy for people and do not make them difficult, give them glad tidings and do not make them run away.
extra.explanation: Islam is ease — not despair. Be kind to yourself too.

extra.text_en: A strong believer is better and more beloved to Allah than a weak believer, though both are good...
extra.explanation: Strength includes emotional strength. Try to rebuild slowly.

duas.text_en: O Allah, there is no ease except what You make easy, and You make the difficult easy if You will.
duas.text_ar: اللَّهُمَّ لا سَهْلَ إِلَّا مَا جَعَلْتَهُ سَهْلًا، وَأَنْتَ تَجْعَلُ الْحَزْنَ إِذَا شِئْتَ سَهْلًا
duas.explanation: Use this when you feel crushed — it’s from the Prophet ﷺ.

duas.text_en: O Turner of the hearts, keep my heart firm upon Your religion.
duas.text_ar: يَا مُقَلِّبَ الْقُلُوبِ ثَبِّتْ قَلْبِي عَلَىٰ دِينِكَ
duas.explanation: For when your faith is shaking and you feel distant.

reflection: Feeling hopeless is not weakness — it’s part of being human. Even prophets felt that way. But the Quran and Sunnah are full of reminders that Allah’s mercy always outweighs the darkness. You’re not forgotten. You’re not unloved. Allah is just one sincere whisper away.
